article.description: Harouna Mutumbo scored 15 points and Mike Williams added 13 as Western Carolina defeated DePaul 69-64 on Tuesday night.
article.headline: DePaul comes up short against Western Carolina
article.linkText: DePaul comes up short against West Carolina
article.story: ROSEMONT, Ill. -- Harouna Mutumbo scored 15 points and Mike Williams added 13 as Western Carolina defeated DePaul 69-64 on Tuesday night. Western Carolina (1-1) added to its 35-23 halftime lead when Mutumbo opened the second half with a three-point play and Brandon Boggs hit a 3-pointer on its next possession. Williams put the Catamounts ahead 46-25 on a 3-pointer with 16:31 left. Mike Stovall's jumper cut the Western Carolina lead to 56-46 with 5:13 left. Then, after Richie Gordon made two free throws for Western Carolina, DePaul (1-1) went on a run that was capped by freshman Brandon Young's steal and layup to get DePaul within 58-53 with 3:43 left. Mutumbo answered with an uncontested layup, and Trey Sumler was 4-for-5 from the foul line inside the last two minutes to secure the victory for Western Carolina. Young led DePaul with 16 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
